metadata.title: On-site influenza vaccination arrangements improved influenza vaccination rate of employees of a tertiary hospital in Singapore

abstract.original_text: Background: On-site vaccination arrangements were introduced in 2005 to improve influenza vaccination rate among employees of a 1500-bed tertiary hospital in Singapore. Methods: On-site arrangements include mobile teams to 3 distant departments and same-service area vaccination for employees at 4 service areas.

sentences.segment_text: Background : On-site vaccination arrangements were introduced in 2005 to improve influenza vaccination rate among employees of a 1500-bed tertiary hospital in Singapore .
Methods : On-site arrangements include mobile teams to 3 distant departments and same-service area vaccination for employees at 4 service areas .

abstract.original_text: Results: Influenza vaccination rate in 2005 was 66.4% (versus 56.8% in 2004, odds ratio 1.50, 95% confidence interval 1.39-1.62). Employees who attended on-site arrangements had higher influenza vaccination rate (97.0%). Conclusion: On-site vaccination arrangements improved influenza vaccination rate among hospital employees. (Am J Infect Control 2007;35:481-3.)

sentences.segment_text: Results : Influenza vaccination rate in 2005 was 66.4 % ( versus 56.8 % in 2004 , odds ratio 1.50 , 95 % confidence interval 1.39-1.62 ) .
Employees who attended on-site arrangements had higher influenza vaccination rate ( 97.0 % ) .
Conclusion : On-site vaccination arrangements improved influenza vaccination rate among hospital employees .
